text:
="preserve">Dezső Tandori (8 December 1938 – 13 February 2019) was an Hungarian writer, poet and literary translator. He was a founding member of the Digital Literature Academy. He won the Attila József Prize in 1978 and was awarded the Kossuth Prize in 1998. He was born in Budapest.
Tandori died on 13 February 2019 in Budapest at the age of 80.
